intro: Rendlia pseudoharpechloa, commonly known as the false harpechloa, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming during the late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
